title: ‘CODA’ Is a Drama About Excessive Regulation
sub_head: Real-life fishermen face the same government adversary as the film’s Rossi family.
body:
“CODA,” which won the Academy Award for Best Picture last week, is a triumph for many reasons. One is that Hollywood recognized the devastating effect of excessive government regulation on American families.
“CODA” is a drama about the deaf community, the perseverance of a loving family, and the impact of a teacher. It also portrays how an overzealous regulatory state can destroy one of America’s oldest industries, New England fisheries.
